datafield.subfield: Clutter and Noise Suppression Based on Match Filter

Background clutter and noise is the vital influence elements for objective detection from space remote sensing imaging data collected. Therefore, clutter and noise suppression is an issue technique to improve detection ratio and reduce false alarm ratio. A match filter design method based on logistical regression is present to solve target detection from rotating camera images with single sampling. According to the characters of targets in images, analyze the target character with single sampling adequately, and chose the learning sample covering all the characters. Considering that clutter and noise are confused into images, Single Cluster Noise Ratio (SCNR) is introduced to evaluate the effectiveness of match filter optimized. Optimization condition is the maximum of SCNR, and iteration optimization is utilized to obtain the module of the match filter. The simulation is completed to compare the performances of the match filter optimized using the method proposed in this paper. Experiment indicates that it is valid for the match filter optimized to process images.
